title: Yahoo Lifestyle
text: Immersing yourself in unfamiliar cultures prompts new insights into familiar people and places. Perhaps sampling a new dish from a local ethnic restaurant reminds you of a special meal from your childhood. Similarly, learning more about people from distant lands makes them seem like your neighbors next door. A trip to a museum, for instance, might be deeply moving as you closely examine art from thousands of years ago. Its amazing how the distance between the far and near can be bridged by your eyes and heart when you choose to reach out. Novelist Ralph Ellison wrote, "Education is all a matter of building bridges." Get Your Complete Cosmic Profile
